meanings.definition: The state of being unwilling or unable to believe something.
meanings.sent1: Her incredulity at the magic show was evident as she refused to believe the disappearing act.
meanings.sent2: His face showed incredulity when he heard the unbelievable news.
meanings.sent3: The incredulity on the dog's face when the cat started talking was priceless.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's incredulity at the student's excuse was as clear as day.
meanings.sent5: The incredulity in the courtroom was palpable as the verdict was read.

meanings.sent1: The child's incredulity at the idea of flying pigs was adorable.
meanings.sent2: There was a sense of incredulity in the room when the alien spaceship landed.
meanings.sent3: The incredulity on his face when he saw the talking parrot was priceless.
meanings.sent4: Her incredulity at the size of the fish she caught was comical.
meanings.sent5: The incredulity in her voice was unmistakable as she recounted the ghostly encounter.
